page.title: 01Smarden West - Intro
page.content: The eastern half of this block is within the Smarden Parish boundary; most of the remainder is in Headcorn but just outside the main village (excluding the railway station) and in the SW corner is a small part of Frittenden. The western edge of Smarden village is included with the Parish Church, a row of council houses and some historic buildings. A great deal of the area is farmland but Marley Farm has become an industrial site with a variety of light industries, and near the Bell Inn is a small factory, once a vintage cider factory but now pressing out plastic parts for lawn mowers. Within the Headcorn area is a large dairy depot and a small airfield for private planes with a flying school and training and practice facilities for parachute jumping.
